name: Bruno Mars
description:
'''Peter Gene Hernandez''' (born October 8, 1985), known professionally as '''Bruno Mars''', is an American [[singer-songwriter]] and record producer. Regarded as a [[pop icon]], he is known for his three-octave [[tenor]] vocal range, live performances, [[Retro style|retro]] showmanship, and musical versatility. He is accompanied by his band, [[Bruno Mars#Band members|the Hooligans]]. Raised in [[Honolulu]], Mars gained recognition in Hawaii as a child for his [[Elvis impersonator|impersonation]] of [[Elvis Presley]], before moving to [[Los Angeles]] in 2003 to pursue a musical career.

Mars established his name in the music industry as a songwriter and co-founder of the production team [[the Smeezingtons]]. He rose to fame as a recording artist after featuring on the US number-one single "[[Nothin' on You]]" (2009) by [[B.o.B]]. Mars's first three studio albums—''[[Doo-Wops & Hooligans]]'' (2010), ''[[Unorthodox Jukebox]]'' (2012), and ''[[24K Magic (album)|24K Magic]]'' (2016)—found critical and commercial success, with the lattermost winning the [[Grammy Award for Album of the Year]]. The albums spawned multiple international hit singles, including "[[Just the Way You Are (Bruno Mars song)|Just the Way You Are]]", "[[Grenade (song)|Grenade]]", "[[The Lazy Song]]", "[[Locked Out of Heaven]]", "[[When I Was Your Man]]", "[[Treasure (song)|Treasure]]", "[[24K Magic (song)|24K Magic]]", "[[That's What I Like (Bruno Mars song)|That's What I Like]]", and "[[Finesse (Bruno Mars song)|Finesse]]". He also featured on [[Mark Ronson]]'s 2014 single "[[Uptown Funk]]", which became [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']]'s [[Billboard Decade-End|best-performing song]] of the [[List of Billboard Hot 100 number-one singles of the 2010s|2010s]].

Mars's success continued throughout the 2020s. In 2021, he formed the [[Supergroup (music)|musical superduo]] [[Silk Sonic]] with [[Anderson .Paak]], and they released the 1970s R&B-inspired album ''[[An Evening with Silk Sonic]]'', which contained the US number-one single "[[Leave the Door Open]]". Mars's 2024 chart-topping duets "[[Die with a Smile]]" with [[Lady Gaga]] and "[[Apt. (song)|Apt.]]" with [[Rosé (singer)|Rosé]] spent a total of 30 weeks atop the [[Billboard Global 200|''Billboard'' Global 200]]. He is the longest-reigning act of the Global 200, spending 30 weeks atop the chart.

Mars has sold over 150 million records worldwide, making him one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists of all time]]. He has nine [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] number-one singles and his [[24K Magic World Tour]] (2017–2018) ranks among the [[List of highest-grossing concert tours|highest-grossing tours in history]]. Mars's [[List of awards and nominations received by Bruno Mars|accolades]] include 16 [[Grammy Award]]s, 14 [[American Music Awards]], 4 [[Brit Awards]], 14 [[Soul Train Awards]], and 8 ''[[Guinness World Records]]''. He has been featured on ''Billboard''{{'}}s Greatest of All Time Artists (2019), as well as the [[Time 100|''Time'' 100]] and [[Forbes Celebrity 100|''Forbes'' Celebrity 100]] lists. Mars was the first artist with six [[RIAA certification|RIAA diamond-certified]] songs and nine [[Music Canada|MC diamond-certified]] songs. He is the first to surpass [[List of most-streamed artists on Spotify|150 million monthly listeners]] on [[Spotify]].
